image.altText: High Court of Australia

props.synopsis: Last year, the High Court found indefinite immigration detention was not legal. Now, two additional cases related to that decision are set to go before it.

title.children: Immigration challenges linked to indefinite detention ruling to go before High Court

image.altText: A church building with a cross shrouded under branches

props.synopsis: The Catholic Church wins a High Court appeal against rulings it was vicariously liable for the actions of a priest who allegedly sexually abused a five-year-old in 1971.

title.children: Catholic Church wins High Court appeal against ruling it was vicariously liable for alleged sexual abuse by a priest

image.altText: A high school aged boy in a grey t-shirt and navy New York Yankees cap smiles.

props.synopsis: It's up to state and territory governments to fund media literacy programs in schools, and a 2023 study of young Australians found only one in four surveyed received a lesson teaching them how to work out if news stories are true in the past year.

title.children: Aaron is in year 11 and recently quit Instagram. He thinks others should do the same

image.altText: High Court of Australia

props.synopsis: Two survivors of alleged child sex abuse win their High Court battle to sue those who placed them in care in the 50s and 60s.

title.children: Two survivors of alleged historic child sex abuse win High Court battle to sue for compensation

image.altText: A blue sign saying Queanbeyan District Health Service sits at the entrance to the carpark of a hospital

props.synopsis: An email obtained by the ABC confirms Queanbeyan Hospital has stopped providing surgical terminations for fetal anomalies and medical reasons, restricting access to a legal and time-critical form of reproductive health care.

title.children: Queanbeyan Hospital bans surgical abortions, telling local health workers the procedure 'does not currently sit within' its scope

image.altText: John has his head in his hand as his sits down part-way through his run.

props.synopsis: John Veloudos has achieved the feat of running 100km, after just three months of training.

title.children: John decided to run 100km after seeing the impact of mental illness

image.altText: A man and woman in dark clothing, carrying bags, walk on a city street.

props.synopsis: The vision shows Clare Nowland getting stuck in a tree in an attempt to escape her aged care facility in the NSW Snowy Mountains, in the weeks before she was tasered by Senior Constable Kristian White.

title.children: Jury shown CCTV footage of 95yo getting stuck in tree in weeks before being tasered by police officer

image.altText: A woman holds a red sign which reads 'i can get 18% more in qld'

props.synopsis: The industrial action has been condemned by the state government who warned of a "challenging day" ahead for people accessing healthcare in the public system, that is not life-preserving or emergency.

title.children: Hundreds of elective surgeries cancelled as 10,000 nurses and midwives walk off job in NSW

image.altText: A man carrying a kangaroo that has burned and bandaged paws.

props.synopsis: Areas that had multiple fires prior to 2019–20 had greater biodiversity losses when Black Summer fires hit compared to areas that had burnt once or not all beforehand.

title.children: Prescribed burns make areas more vulnerable to biodiversity loss during bushfires: study

image.altText: A girl in a red jumper and black tracksuit pants sits on a couch indoors at night looking at her mobile phone.

props.synopsis: Social media companies would be required to take preventative action against the worst foreseeable harms of their platforms under new laws the federal government has proposed.

title.children: Online platforms would be legally responsible for keeping Australians safe under new 'duty of care' laws

image.altText: Reynolds stands in front of a infantry vehicle.

props.synopsis: After a defence employee handed confidential information to weapons company Thales, only to join the company later, a former defence minister has blasted the defence department that continues to award contracts to the same company.

title.children: 'A big smell': Former defence minister blasts department over alleged corruption in Thales deal

image.altText: A composite image of three pictures of a young girl dressed as a ballerina

props.synopsis: A mother accused of starving her daughter tells a Perth court she thought the orange marks around her mouth were due to the teenager's appetite for carrots and pumpkin, not because she was malnourished, as a doctor advised.

title.children: Brittle hair, orange marks and failure to gain weight were not signs of malnutrition, mother tells starvation trial

image.altText: Vladimir Putin and Kim Jong Un walking through a rose garden together.

props.synopsis: Vladimir Putin and Kim Jong Un announced a mutual defence agreement earlier this year, which has paved the way for an estimated 10,000 North Korean troops to join in Russia's fight against Ukraine.

title.children: US vows 'firm response' to North Korean deployment on Ukraine front line

image.altText: Donald Trump looks sideways while standing at a podium

props.synopsis: Billionaires, Fox News personalities, and staunch loyalists. These are the people president-elect Donald Trump is choosing to run the United States as part of his incoming 2025 administration.

title.children: Meet the key figures Trump has picked to run the United States

image.altText: a woman sits on a park bench smiling

props.synopsis: Kath Koschel had to learn how to walk again twice. The help she experienced on the way inspired her to teach young people about the healing power of kindness.

title.children: Kath Koschel had to learn to walk again twice and lost her partner. Now she's the NSW Australian of the Year

image.altText: A white middle-aged man in a suit speaks, grey hair turning to white in front of an Australian flag

props.synopsis: Labor has ruled out revisiting a scrapped policy from 2019 that would have linked federal funding for public hospitals to the provision of abortion services, saying it's an issue for the states and territories.

title.children: Labor and the Coalition seek to avoid an election debate about abortion, as Greens call for greater access

image.altText: Prabowo Subianto shakes the hand of Joe Biden among portraits of former US presidents

props.synopsis: Indonesia's new President Prabowo Subianto is eager to assert a much stronger presence on the global stage than his predecessor — with mixed success.

title.children: 'Your English is so good': Call with Trump overshadows Indonesian president's meeting with Biden

image.altText: asian man wearing cream blazer and white shirt

props.synopsis: South Korean actor Song Jae-lim, known for his role in the K-drama Moon Embracing the Sun, has died aged 39.

title.children: South Korean actor Song Jae-lim found dead at age 39

image.altText: A house with Shawline Publishing's logo out the front, there is also a For Lease sign.

props.synopsis: Authors who had their books published through a company that has gone into liquidation say they are thousands of dollars out of pocket.

title.children: Australian authors count the cost of publisher's collapse

image.altText: Convicted sex offender Peter John van de Wetering smiling in front of a grey wall

props.synopsis: Peter van de Wetering was sentenced to nine years in 2016 for the violent attack on the 19-year-old woman.

title.children: Backpacker rapist who lured woman to remote Queensland farm wins appeal for release

image.altText: Archbishop of Canterbury Justin Welby during his enthronement ceremony in 2013.

props.synopsis: The process to choose Mr Welby's successor as the spiritual leader of the Anglican church will now begin.

title.children: 'The right and honourable thing to do': Why Archbishop of Canterbury Justin Welby resigned over an abuse scandal

image.altText: A man in a suit outside of a court house

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation has uncovered a disturbing escalation in rhetoric from prominent neo-Nazis in Australia, including comments about encouraging violent crime.

title.children: 'Touch our kids, it's over': Neo-Nazi issues chilling warning to authorities

image.altText: A thick cloud of grey and white smoke coming out of a volcano with trees and bushes surrounding it.

props.synopsis: Jetstar, Qantas and Virgin Australia have cancelled flights to and from Bali until at least Wednesday afternoon.

title.children: Flights to and from Bali cancelled after volcanic eruption creates thick ash cloud

image.altText: A black dog stands close to the camera while wearing a harness with a handle being held by a person in biege shorts.

props.synopsis: Peter Frank and his dog are seeking compensation and "change" after two drivers refused to pick him up at Melbourne Airport in 2023.

title.children: Uber sued after drivers 'point-blank' refuse rides to Melbourne teacher and his assistance dog

image.altText: Adnyamathanha elder Uncle Charles Jackson.

props.synopsis: It has been almost one month since Port Augusta became a Declared Public Precinct, but Uncle Charles Jackson OAM says the move simply shifts the issues "out of sight".

title.children: 'It's directed at First Nations people': Elder shares concerns about Declared Public Precinct in Port Augusta

image.altText: a man standing in front of an aisle of groceries

props.synopsis: The charity says there is an increasing demand for food in the state, which coincides with a 15 per cent decrease in donations.

title.children: 70,000 Victorians at risk of going hungry this Christmas, Foodbank says

image.altText: Danny Gibson smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: The former mayor and current councillor of Tasmania's second-largest city has resigned from his position on the Local Government Association of Tasmania, with allegations of unwanted sexual advances against young men unaddressed.

title.children: Calls for an 'independent investigation' after thousands in ratepayer funds spent on Tasmanian councillors' legal fees

image.altText: Koala sitting on a bed inside a house.

props.synopsis: Something soft and cuddly on a bed can be a welcome sight if that something is inanimate, like a pillow — but in the early hours of Wednesday morning an Adelaide couple were forced to contend with a friendly, if unexpected, intruder.

title.children: 'We believe he came through the dog door': Koala sitting on bed startles couple on return from work

image.altText: A sketch of courtroom proceedings

props.synopsis: More than 15 years after victims of torture at Iraq's Abu Ghraib prison lodged a lawsuit against a US contractor, a jury hands down a verdict.

title.children: Former Abu Ghraib detainees awarded $64 million in damages over abuses at Iraqi prison

image.altText: Exterior of Newcastle court.

props.synopsis: A woman with dissociative identity disorder has almost thrown up in the witness box, while being cross-examined about alleged child sexual abuse by her father.

title.children: Woman with multiple personalities becomes woozy in witness box while reliving alleged abuse by father

image.altText: The light plane landed safely at Newcastle Airport just after noon today

props.synopsis: The plane was forced to circle above Newcastle Airport for several hours before its pilot made a "textbook" emergency landing earlier this year. The pilot and two passengers walked away unhurt.

title.children: Crack in light plane caused landing gear failure and dramatic wheels-up landing, report finds

image.altText: Composite image of six victims of jumping castle tragedy with school signage as background

props.synopsis: An engineer says having all available anchor points secured on a jumping castle may not have prevented it becoming airborne — but still, not enough was done to ensure safety before six children died in 2021.

title.children: Engineer says Hillcrest jumping castle may still have become airborne even if all anchors were used

image.altText: A young woman with wavy brown hair and sunglasses on top of her head.

props.synopsis: A new coronial inquest into the 2005 death of German backpacker Simone Strobel in Lismore has heard from the detective in charge that "nothing had changed" when police decided to prosecute her then-boyfriend 17 years after her death.

title.children: Detective admits no fresh evidence to justify prosecution of dead German backpacker Simone Strobel's boyfriend

image.altText: Semi rural land with some cattle and green paddocks, small industrial

props.synopsis: Residents make a final plea to the Independent Planning Commission to reject a proposed $88-million plastic recycling plant in Moss Vale due to concerns over its environmental, health, and community impact.

title.children: Julia Zemiro among residents fighting plan to build recycling plant in 'renaissance' town
